title: About
text: Hi everyone, my name is Jessie Magalit and I am from Chicago, IL. I am currently double majoring in Ecosystem Science & Sustainability and Apparel Design & Production. Some of my favorite past times include thrifting, sewing, up-cycling, cooking/baking, and going to art museums. I look forward to displaying my academic accomplishments on this website that I created myself using code!

title: About
text:
Education
DePaul University, Chicago | Chicago, IL Transferred | Aug 2020-May 2022
Colorado State University, Fort Collins | Fort Collins, CO Bachelors in Ecosystem Science & Sustainability | Aug 2022-May 2026

title: About
text:
Experience
Computer Lab Operator | Senior Lab Op | January 2023-present

title: Projects
text: In the Spring of 2025 I took a class Quantitative Reasoning class based in R. I wrote some code, and did some cool data science. Here is a collection of links!

title: Projects
text:
Lab 1 [Building a Project Website] (index.qmd)

In our lab 1 assignment we created a website with github pages.
Through this assignment we utilized a github repo to access all the code.
I am so proud of how much I have learned so far, and I am excited to see how to advance through the semester.

title: Resume
text:
-Bachelor of Science in Apparel and Merchandising Expected Graduation May 2026 1st Concentration Apparel Design and Production

2nd Concentration Sustainability Colorado State University, Fort Collins, Colorado

title: Resume
text:
Skills

Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Excel, WordPress, CLO 3D (introductory)
Industrial and domestic sewing machines, plotters, scanners, printers, projectors
Hand sewing, embroidery, crocheting, upcycling, garment construction and tailoring since 2009

Coursework

Apparel Design and Production: Apparel Design I, Apparel and Merchandising Digital Technology, Consumers in the Marketplace, Fashion Illustration, Fashion Industries, Historic Costume, Merchandising Processes, Patternmaking I-III (Flat, draping and CAD), Product Development I, Textile Science I and II
Sustainability: Biology I and II, Calculus for Biological Scientists, Ecology, Physics, Physical Geography, Science of Global Climate Change, Systems Theory for Sustainability
Business: Accounting I and II, Business Analytics, Business Statistics, Consumer Behavior, Effective Business Communication, Finance, Management, Marketing, Macroeconomics, Microeconomics.

title: Resume
text:
